ygData.subject: Re: Bugs from last patch (OT ?)
ygData.msgSnippet: Something very much like this happened to me last night, causing me to lose my level.  I turned in the crafted greaves components and got the greaves and exp,
ygData.messageBody:
Something very much like this happened to me last night, causing me to
lose my level. I turned in the crafted greaves components and got the
greaves and exp, and all the centaurs immediately attacked me. Guides
said too bad, so sad so, I guess it's back to the birdhouse for me. I
didn't attack (my attack key is f12, so I was nowhere near that) and I
didn't accidentally hit any area spells (the hotkey page I was on
didn't have any area spells on it). Plus, they didn't attack my group
partner after I was dead. I didn't get a chance to check if they were
still KOS to me, since I had my body dragged to the bridge and camped
after I got dressed. I was not terribly happy that the guides
wouldn't res me after such an obvious bug, but with no way to prove
it, I guess they really can't do anything. Anyone else have this
happen on other quests?


Robynn, back to level 20, E'ci

> This is another bug I have run into which creeped in in the last patch.
> Apparently if you complete the Squad Ring Quest currently, you are handed
> the ring and also immediately moved to KoS status will all residents of
> Rivervale. How the heck do they miss this stuff? Sounds like they either
> changed the faction hit for getting the ring, say from 5% to 100% (oops
> D'Vinn coder, should been 10%) or they added a faction gain that puts the
> faction 'over the top' thus turning it into a negative number. After
> telling my bardic friend on E'ci how cool the ring was he finally completed
> the quest this morning. He is currently unable to play that character after
> immediately dying to Marshal Ghobber and reappearing at his bind point...
> Right in front of the PoD in the middle of Rivervale square. Needless to
> say the overzealous litle Zorros immediately whacked him again... and
> again... and again... before he figured out what must be happening and
> pulled the plug. I saw 4 corpses in the Marshal Ghobber room last nite but
> thought little of it chalking it up to the usual
> W...H "Hail Marshal Ghobber"...A "you hit Marshal Ghobber but he dodges"
> syndrome of forgetting to hit ENTER first.
> This appears to be a major screwup that has seriously affected quite a
> number of characters due to careless coding yet again. I'm certain my
> friend has lost at least one level if not more before he was disconnected.
> Not to mention the incredible amount of work he put into getting his faction
> high enough to get the ring in the first place.
> Has anyone else experienced this?
> Does anyone have any word on how they are planning on fixing this?

--
Katy Westerman Don't lick something unless
katyw@... you really mean it.
http://www.cs.ucr.edu/~katyw -Advice from the Naked
CS/Comp Math Major, UC Riverside Dancing Llama
